content: coraline squid ornament free crochet pattern what s shakin baby it s christmas time this pattern is copyrighted by morbidly made you cannot reproduce change or claim this pattern as your own you may make and sell items made from this pattern however you must credit me by linking back to my shop i would love to see your spooky creations please feel free to tag me on facebook instagram etc this ornament is based on the character from the movie coraline made from neil gaimans book and produced by laika this pattern is beginner level if you have any questions please email me or message me via etsy email morbidlymade@gmail com facebook https //m facebook com/morbidlymade instagram @morbidlymade materials -hobby lobby s i love this cotton in turquoise -3 5 mm crochet hook e -large pink button -sewing needle -scissors and stitch marker -poly-fil abbreviations -magic_ring magic_ring -single_crochet single_crochet -increase increase -decrease decrease ears/fins round 1 single_crochet 6 in magic_ring 6 round 2 increase single_crochet 1 repeat around 9 round 3 single_crochet around 9 round 4 increase single_crochet 2 repeat around 12 round 5 single_crochet around 12 round 6 increase single_crochet 3 repeat around 15 round 7 single_crochet around 12 round 8 increase single_crochet 4 repeat around 18 round 9 single_crochet around 18 f/o leave a long tail for sewing note these will not be stuffed they will be flattened before sewing body round 1 single_crochet 6 in magic_ring 6 round 2 increase around 12 round 3 single_crochet 1 increase repeat around 18 round 4 single_crochet 2 increase repeat around 24 round 5 single_crochet 3 increase repeat around 30 round 6 single_crochet 4 increase repeat around 36 round 7 single_crochet 5 increase repeat around 42 round 8 single_crochet 6 increase repeat around 48 at this point you create your string to hang it make a chain with 36 stitches and sew both ends to the very top of your ornament hide ends inside round 9-17 single_crochet around 48 round 18 single_crochet 6 decrease repeat around 42 at this point sew the button in the middle hiding the end inside round 19 single_crochet 5 decrease repeat around 36 round 20 single_crochet 4 decrease repeat around 30 round 21 single_crochet 3 decrease repeat around 24 round 22 single_crochet 2 decrease repeat around 18 round 23 single_crochet 1 decrease repeat around 12 round 24 decrease around 6 before you sew the hole closed sew the ears on then using your needle sew the hole closed hide the end
